meanings.definition: The top rail of a fence or railing.
meanings.sent1: The headrails of the fence were painted white.
meanings.sent2: I leaned on the headrails of the railing to get a better view.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the headrails of the fence, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts raced like a runaway train along the headrails of the fence.
meanings.sent5: The headrails of the fence stood tall and proud, guarding the garden.

meanings.definition: A horizontal bar at the top of a window frame.
meanings.sent1: She gazed out of the window, resting her arms on the headrails.
meanings.sent2: The curtains hung gracefully from the headrails of the window frame.
meanings.sent3: The cat perched on the headrails of the window, watching the world outside.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight streamed through the headrails, casting a warm glow in the room.
meanings.sent5: Raindrops collected on the headrails of the window, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The uppermost part of a ship's railing.
meanings.sent1: The salty breeze swept through the headrails of the ship.
meanings.sent2: Seagulls perched on the headrails, looking out to sea.
meanings.sent3: The captain stood proudly by the headrails, surveying the vast ocean.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight reflected off the headrails, illuminating the deck.
meanings.sent5: The crew members gathered around the headrails, sharing stories of their adventures.
